content: भोगः [भुज्-घञ्] {@--1@} Eating, consuming. {@--2@} Enjoyment, fruition. {@--3@} Possession. {@--4@} Utility, advantage. {@--5@} Ruling, governing, government. {@--6@} Use, application (as of a deposit). {@--7@} Suffering, enduring, experiencing. {@--8@} Feeling, perception. {@--9@} Enjoyment of women, sexual enjoyment, carnal pleasure. {@--10@} An enjoyment, an object of enjoyment or pleasure; भोगे रोगभयं <ls>Bh. 3. 35</ls>; <ls>Bg. 1. 32.</ls> {@--11@} A repast, feast, banquet. {@--12@} Food. {@--13@} Food offered to an idol. {@--14@} Profit, gain. {@--15@} Income, revenue. {@--16@} Wealth. {@--17@} The wages of prostitutes {@--18@} A cover, coil, winding. {@--19@} The (expanded) hood of a snake; श्वसदसितभुजंगभोगांगदग्रांथि &c. <ls>Māl. 5. 23</ls>; <ls>R. 10. 7</ls>, <ls n="R.">11. 59.</ls> {@--20@} A snake. {@--21@} The body. {@--22@} An army in column. {@--23@} The passing (of an asterism). {@--24@} The part of the ecliptic occupied by each of the 27 Nakṣatras.
